alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 7:40PM EDT until September 09 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ricketts Glen State Park, Muncy Valley, Dushore, Laporte and Eagles Mere. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
